case_vignette: A 14-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his mother because of a 1-month history of pain in his right leg. His mother has been giving him ketorolac at night to improve his sleep, but the pain has not improved. Physical examination shows marked tenderness along the right mid-femur. An x-ray of the right lower extremity shows several lytic lesions in the diaphysis of the femur and a surrounding cortex covered by several layers of new bone. A biopsy of the right femur shows small round blue cells.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?
